comment.author: 50600163@N07
comment._content: In these illustrious times [from c.1928-32] my mother - Joan Willis, and Aunt - Gwyneth Willis (Gwen) attended the LSE, both studying B.Sc Econ courses, Gwen knew lots of people , some became famous politicians.  She was there before my mother, who started in 1930. Does any one out there remmber them? They look very august!  I was a student in 1961-67 on first & second degree courses, a nd by then things were very different - much more casual!  Their married names after c. 1935 were: Mrs Gwyneth Webb and Mrs. Joan Hornsey.

comment.author: 35128489@N07
comment._content:
Hi Tigresstwickers,

Thank you for all your comments! Both Joan and Gwyneth are listed in the LSE registers that we have here in Archives. These were compiled in the mid-1930s and include lists of students and staff, with brief summaries of their careers both pre- and post-LSE. We'd be happy to send you copies or transcriptions of their entries, just drop us a line at document@lse.ac.uk.
